Angle Processing Unit

Angle Processing Unit contains the angle processing unit component in the referenced FPGA. Angle Processing Unit provides the engine speed for the given Engine Simulation and provides feedback channels for the angles.

What do you want to do?

Change the rate of RPM change

To change the acceleration rate for the angle processing unit, change the value in the Acceleration control found on the page below. A value of positive infinity indicates rpm changes will take effect immediately. This feature requires a bitfile compiled with AES 2.5 or later.

Add angle(s)

To add angle(s), click the Add Angle(s) button. You also can right-click Angle Processing Unit in the configuration tree and select Add Angle(s) from the shortcut menu. Possible angles to add include the crank angle and cycle angle.

Remove angle(s)

To remove a single angle, select the angle in the configuration tree and click the red X button.

To remove multiple angles, click the Remove Angle(s) button. You also can right-click Angle Processing Unit in the configuration tree and select Remove Angle(s) from the shortcut menu.

View or change an angle processing unit channel

To view or change an angle processing unit's channel, select the channel in the configuration tree. The Channel page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

For more information about adding and configuring custom devices, refer to the Configuring and Running a Project book of the NI VeriStand Help, available by selecting Help»Search the NI VeriStand Help.
